data.title: Orson Welles
data.text:
AKA George Orson Welles

Born: 6-May-1915

Birthplace: Kenosha, WI

Died: 10-Oct-1985

Location of death: Hollywood, CA

Cause of death: Heart Failure

Remains: Cremated (ashes buried on the estate of Antonio Ordonez, Ronda, Spain)

Gender: Male

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Actor, Radio Personality, Film Director

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: Citizen Kane

Father: Richard Head Welles (inventor, b. 13-Oct-1872, d. 28-Dec-1930 kidney failure)

Mother: Beatrice Ives (concert pianist, b. 1-Sep-1883, d. 10-May-1924 jaundice)

Brother: Richard Ives Welles (b. 1905)

Wife: Virginia Nicolson (actress, m. 20-Dec-1934, div. 1939, d. 1996, one daughter)

Daughter: Chris Welles Feder (b. 27-Mar-1938)

Girlfriend: Billie Holiday (early 1940s)

Wife: Rita Hayworth (m. 7-Sep-1943, div. 1-Dec-1948, one daughter)

Daughter: Rebecca Welles (actress, b. 17-Dec-1944, d. 10-Oct-2004)

Girlfriend: Eartha Kitt (early 1950s)

Wife: Paola Mori (m. 8-May-1955, until his death, d. 12-Aug-1986 automobile accident, one daughter)

Daughter: Beatrice (b. 13-Nov-1955)

Mistress: Oja Kodar (together 1962 until his death)

High School: Todd School for Boys, Woodstock, IL (1930)

Hollywood Anti-Fascist League

Sleepy Lagoon Defense Committee

Broadcasting and Cable Hall of Fame

Oscar (honorary) 1971

Oscar for Best Screenplay 1942 for Citizen Kane (with Herman J. Mankiewicz)

Radio Hall of Fame

Hollywood Walk of Fame 1600 Vine St. (motion pictures)

D. W. Griffith Award

American Film Institute Life Achievement Award 1975

Draft Deferment: World War II

Endorsement of Paul Masson Cabernet Savignon 1980

Endorsement of Jim Beam 1971

Risk Factors: Obesity, Asthma

TELEVISION

Magnum, P.I. Robin Masters (voice, 1981-83)

FILMOGRAPHY AS DIRECTOR

The Other Side of the Wind (31-Aug-2018)

It's All True (15-Oct-1993)

F For Fake (Sep-1974)

The Immortal Story (24-May-1968)

Chimes at Midnight (22-Dec-1965)

The Tragedy of Othello: The Moor of Venice (10-May-1952)

Macbeth (1-Oct-1948)

The Stranger (25-May-1946)

The Magnificent Ambersons (10-Jul-1942)

Citizen Kane (1-May-1941)
